entry.title: “Peace Amidst the Storm” - 3ABN Today Family Worship (TDYFW210030)

media:group.media:title: “Peace Amidst the Storm” - 3ABN Today Family Worship (TDYFW210030)
media:group.media:description:
Men, women, and children are experiencing fear and anxiety as never before. Yet, Jesus said in Matthew 24 stated, “… see that ye be not troubled … all these are the beginning of sorrows.” In this 3ABN Family Worship, we would like to discuss how we may find true peace, comfort, strength, and hope amidst our storms of life. So, join Pastor Kenny & Chris Shelton along with Danny & Yvonne Shelton as they present, “Peace Amidst the Storm.”

media:group.media:description:
In this sermon produced by 3ABN, Pastor John Lomacang will share from the Bible how we are on the verge of the time of trouble. It can't be stopped. entry.title: “Is It Okay to Work on the Sabbath?“ 3ABN Today Bible Q & A (TDYQA210028)

media:group.media:title: “Is It Okay to Work on the Sabbath?“ 3ABN Today Bible Q & A (TDYQA210028)
media:group.media:description:
God's Fourth Commandment says we should refrain from working on Sabbath, but some jobs require it. Are there any exceptions? Find out the answer to this question—and many more—on 3ABN Today Bible Q & A with Greg and Jill Morikone, Ryan Day, and James Rafferty.
Send us your Bible Questions! By email: BibleQA@3abn.org By text: (618) 228-3975

entry.title: “Preamble to Deuteronomy” | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 1 Q4 2021

media:group.media:title: “Preamble to Deuteronomy” | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 1 Q4 2021
media:group.media:description:
Sabbath School panel discussion and insight by 3ABN pastors and teachers. This video follows 2021 quarter 4, lesson 1 of the adult Bible study guide book. This quarter's book topic is “Present Truth in Deuteronomy” and this week's Sabbath School lesson is titled “Preamble to Deuteronomy” Join us every week for a fresh and relevant study of the word of God.
Isa. 14:12–14, Ezek. 28:12– 17, Gen. 3:1–7, Gen. 12:1–3, Acts 7:20–36, Exod. 19:4–8.
“He who does not love does not know God, for God is love” (1 John 4:8, NKJV).
(September 25–October 1)
Sunday (Shelley Quinn) - “Love, to be Loved” Monday (Ryan Day) - “The Fall and the Flood” Tuesday (John Lomacang) - “The Call of Abram” Wednesday (Jill Morikone) - “The Covenant at Sinai” Thursday (James Rafferty) - “Apostasy and Punishment”
🔴ONLINE SABBATH SCHOOL LESSON https://absg.adventist.org/pdf.php?file=2021:4Q:SE:PDFs:EAQ421_01.pdf
🔗SABBATH SCHOOL PANEL WEBSITE: https://3abnsabbathschoolpanel.com/
🔗SABBATH SCHOOL PANEL PODCAST: https://3abn.org/ssp-podcast.html

media:group.media:title: Love Without Measure | Shelley Quinn
media:group.media:description:
What is the most important thing about you? What is love, and how can it be measured? Do you know that you are the object of God’s love—even if you have rejected Him? Presenting Bible truths of God’s love for all humanity and—most especially—for His covenant people, Shelley concludes that although we can know and experience God’s love, it remains for us immeasurable and unfathomable. Something can only be measured if there is a standard unit to which it can be compared. There is no human standard with which God’s love can be measured.
